content:
EDIT:

* Removed REVERSE mode due to being to difficult to predict the operations

* Re-worded constraints to exclude `[a-zA-Z0-9]` since it basically gives away the regex (Users should be able to understand what <<alphanumeric>> means ^^)

this should not be reverse - one of those "do some random operation on something, but also another operation on something else and ..."

it's trivial to create a hard problem, it's tough to create an interesting problem

Interesting.
I was waiting to see if you would have multiple spaces between words, but it looks like there were none. I only counted the number of spaces, and I got through with 100%. Might be more challenging to have some multiple spaces.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like this problem. Well defined and communicated.

I like the idea, it's very simple and the statement is clear. I would add at least one more test case (split test 4/validator 4 into two), because currently there is no validator with multiple consecutive digits and no visible test with 0s. To make it solvable in reverse mode you might want to add even more. Also the stub generator is missing write command.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems fun.
I reached moderator level just to accept this contribution :)

I have a couple points I would like fixed before approving :

- The part 'separated by whitespace' is too much in the goal. It should be removed or put on another line.
- You are not multiplying 'numbers' but digits. It would be way more complicated to look for numbers.
- What is the product of zero numbers? For me its 1, not 0. It should be stated explicitly.

So the Statement would become:
@Goal
Given a sentence 's' multiply all digits present in 's' and add the number of words in 's'.
Words are separated by spaces.
The product of zero digits is 0.

That said, I think this is a cool classic clash of code :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's fun and simple. I'd love to see this problem in CoC. Good job!!

If you say that s contains only alphanumeric characters, you can't put whitespace. Or remove this constraint. You should remove the ",to the result", that is useless in the subject.
Also, the subject is false, the number of words have to be added, not the number of capital letters (see test 3, or test 2, or even your code).
Thank you Tiouz! I was in a rush when I wrote this and it is also my first submission! I hope it is better now.

Thank you very much for the positive feedback!
I made the rightfully requested changes . Hopefully you will find it "approving" worthy now :)
Thank you very much, I have made the changes and tested them. :thumbsup:

100%

I just got this in reverse and only 1/8 of us solved it.
It was maddening.

I did my 50th clash today just to approve it :D

For the solution, you should use the str.isdigit(). Way simpler ;)

numbers = list(int(c) for c in s if c.isdigit())
